akn:content.akn:p: (a) Specific authorities The Commission has the power—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Judicial orders for compliance with subpenas and orders of Commission; contempt of court

akn:content.akn:p: (b) Judicial orders for compliance with subpenas and orders of Commission; contempt of court Upon petition by the Commission, any United States district court within the jurisdiction of which any inquiry is being carried on may, in case of refusal to obey a subpena or order of the Commission issued under subsection (a), issue an order requiring compliance. Any failure to obey the order of the court may be punished by the court as a contempt thereof.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Civil liability for disclosure of information

akn:content.akn:p: (c) Civil liability for disclosure of information No person shall be subject to civil liability to any person (other than the Commission or the United States) for disclosing information at the request of the Commission.

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Concurrent transmissions to Congress or Member of budget estimates, etc.; prior submission of legislative recommendations, testimony, or comments on legislation

akn:content.akn:p: (d) Concurrent transmissions to Congress or Member of budget estimates, etc.; prior submission of legislative recommendations, testimony, or comments on legislation

(e) Exclusive civil remedy for enforcement Except as provided in section 30109(a)(8) of this title, the power of the Commission to initiate civil actions under subsection (a)(6) shall be the exclusive civil remedy for the enforcement of the provisions of this Act.
